body_html: @formath That sounds like it could be a different problem. However, there isn't enough information in that one stack to diagnose the cause: it just tells us that one call to sess.run() is hanging somewhere. Can you please open a new issue with a minimal reproducible example and/or a full set of thread stacks? Also, to remove a potential source of complexity, please try to reproduce it using tf.Session() instead of tf.Session(rpc_server) (although if it only reproduces in an RPC-based session, then that would tell us something useful).

body: @formath That sounds like it could be a different problem. However, there isn't enough information in that one stack to diagnose the cause: it just tells us that one call to `sess.run()` is hanging somewhere. Can you please open a new issue with a minimal reproducible example and/or a full set of thread stacks? Also, to remove a potential source of complexity, please try to reproduce it using `tf.Session()` instead of `tf.Session(rpc_server)` (although if it only reproduces in an RPC-based session, then that would tell us something useful).
